name: Conrad Centennial Singapore

reviews.text: v stayed in this hotel for 2 nites on 26 & 27th April.On my earlier visit i had stayed at Grand Copthrone Waterfront and had fun there.Check in was smooth and the room was great.Since i was on official trip..i had to share my room with 1 of my sub-ordinate.but the room was big and the furniture was new and plush.Breakfast was terrific with lots of lip smacking dishes.Location wise..its great hotel with suntec centre right in front of it.Commuting was not a problem as taxis and MRT is easliy available.
reviews.title: Nice hotel,great location

reviews.text: The staff was courteous and polite.Great location and great hotel.Cant wait to get back.
reviews.title: Perfect business hotel

reviews.text: This is a typical 5 star chain hotel, huge,bland and lacking atmosphere but excellent for its type. The rooms are beautiful, beds huge and inoffensive colours and design. Lots of nice touches - fruit basket, chocolates and rubber duck for the tub. Good room service and an excellent in-room breakfast menu. The staff are friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Par Excellence Service

reviews.text: I was a bit apprehensive at staying at The Conrad, but this hotel by far exceeded my expectations. The hotel is a luxury property opposite the Convention Centre, amidst various shopping malls, both high ended as well as mid-level.
reviews.title: A great experience

likes.disliked: — The internet connection from the room that you had to pay for was not consistent

reviews.text: Check in was smooth, as is expeceted from any luxury hotel. What impressed me most, was the interest taken by room service to make sure that no guest sleeps hungry. With my limited taste in food, the hostess made sure she sent dinner to me to suit my taste buds. This is something that I miss in most hotels in India too, despite vegetarian food being available very predominantly.
reviews.title: Excellent business hotel

likes.disliked: — Expensive internet access

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights on business.
reviews.title: very comfortable

reviews.text: Very good for my purpose with the high levels of service you get used to at hotels of this type in Singapore. Very comfortable & no hassle.
reviews.title: Conrad hotel / Singapore

likes.disliked: — No opinion

reviews.title: An excellent executive stay
reviews.text: Very helpful and professional staff.

reviews.title: bad first impression
reviews.text: Large and very nicely furnished room.

reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.text: Restaurant meals available from very early to very late (except for alcohol), which was useful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a night. Checking in is a breeze and staff service were excellent. No inferior service from them even though we were Singaporeans. Concierge guy has great memory too.
reviews.title: Terrific stay and excellent service!

reviews.text: Room is extremely clean. The bed is comfy and love their spacious bathroom. Overall a good stay.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: The rooms were nice and clean, hotel was comfortable but if you are there to be near the shopping stay in orchard road. Suntec is beside the hotel but Orchard has more places to go. The hotel itself is great and their breakfast excellent, but hotel is more for businessmen than for children even if they give teddy bears and rubber duckies (nice touch though)
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel one night on the executive floor. The room was comfortable and verything looked ok. The executive floor breakfast was decent. There is an outdoor pool in the hotel. The staff was extermely polite and acccomodating. The only down side for this hotel is I think the high price. Other than that it upholds the Hilton standards to the most extend.
reviews.title: Second time visit to the hotel. as pleasant as the previous time

reviews.text: Fruit basket is great! Thx! Room is a bit small but functional. Location wise, easy access to new touristy spots and shopping. Long cab waiting time tho. Reliable hotel!
reviews.title: good hotel away from center

reviews.text: I have stayed at Raffles Plaza for years when in Singapore, so approached my stay here with a little trepidation. I needed not worry, the hotel is exceelent inside. It is not as well located, but next to Suntec and very handy. MRT is 10 mins away and an up/over/under walk, not so good. However, remember Singapore is small so 5 mins walk can change your view of lcoation! My room was clean, well equipped with a side view of the water, and a close up view of rooms in the nearby Pan Pacific, which forces a little discreteness. I will definately stay here again as the staff and service were top notch.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: This was the first stay I had in the Conrad as the previous Singapore hotel (which was amazing) stopped offering corp rates to me. The room I stayed is tired and really needed some updating. Service was efficient and good and the buffet breakfast not bad at all. The hotel just feels and looks its age on the inside.
reviews.title: Very average business hotel
Great hotel in a great location
reviews.text: This property is one of the better in Singapore I think. I like the location even though most people prefer to stay in the Orchard Rd. area if they are on a leisure trip this hotel has some excellent rates on the weekend and you get a top notch hotel. There is a mall next door to the hotel that has some excellent dining options if you dont want to eat at the hotel and there are some dining options in the street in back of the hotel as well. The workout equipment is a bit old but fine for a workout and the pool is large and seems never to be very busy. Service at the hotel is top notch.

Stayed in the Conrad Singapore during the Xmas holiday season in 2006. The hotel is well located for business travellers - especially anyone attending conventions at the gigantic Suntec City convention centre, which is literally across the road. It is very close to the financial district too. Paulaner Brauhaus - a German-themed microbrewery - is next door for those who need to quench their thirst.
reviews.title: Decent hotel for the business traveller

likes.disliked: — Rooms a little dated...

reviews.text: Efficient and courteous staff, the hotel ticks all the boxes and there is little to fault. The rooms are starting to look a little dated, but are spacious enough and very clean. Room rates are a relative bargain compared to other 5-star hotels in Singapore.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!!

likes.disliked: — Attempts to service room before 9:30 a.m.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you to all the lovely staff at the Conrad! We arrived jet lagged and bedraggled and were welcomed and made comfortable.
reviews.title: Relax in luxury!

reviews.text: Our room wasn't ready (at 9.30am!) so we were taken to the club lounge and given coffee and made comfortable for the half hour it took to make it available.Our 3 night stay that followed was wonderful. Staff were aways friendly, smiling and happy to help. the hotel had all the amenities you would expect from a luxury hotel.
reviews.title: Just delightful

reviews.text: Our room was well appointed and spacious with a view of the harbour. Toiletries in the bathroom were top quality as were the furnishings and linen.
reviews.title: What you'd expect from Conrad

reviews.text: A stopover after a European holiday turned out to be a highlight of our trip.
reviews.title: Delightful Haven
Comfortable and pleasant
reviews.text: Well done Conrad staff!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the hotel is mainly for the business traveller, it is an excellent hotel for the tourist. It is located centrally with a set of interlocking malls only a few steps away and the hop-on/hop-off bus terminal is across the street. It is also only a 10 minute walk to the Singapore Flier (Ferris Wheel) and not much further to the river area with restaurants and entertainment. There are several restaurants within easy walking distance.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: The hotel is luxurious and the rooms are adequately-sized although the T.V. on the side wall makes it difficult to watch. The breakfast in the Executive lounge has a great choice with Western, Asian, and Japanese food along with all the usual fruit, pastries, etc. The lounge also provides an all-day bar with an afternoon tea and evening snacks. We were upgraded to the lounge as Hilton Diamond members but it would represent good value for all the benefits.
reviews.title: Very good hotel - couple of faults

reviews.text: The pool is large, 20 m by 10 m, for a city centre hotel and there are good sun loungers with umbrellas along with tree cover. The staff also bring round iced water at regular intervals.
reviews.title: absolutely an outstanding hotel with excellent service and value for money

reviews.text: The staff throughout the hotel are excellent and willing to be of service.
reviews.title: Great hotel if you come to Singapore for shopping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel and service is excellent. My only complaints about this hotel are that the rooms are small compared to other similar hotels in the area and in same price range. Also the TV's are on the side wall - so if you want to watch TV from bed you quickly get a sore neck. There are only 2 restaurants - Oscars (multi cuisine) and Golden Peony (Cantonese) - which is little choice for such a big hotel. But otherwise great hotel.
reviews.title: Really genuine, friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Great location in Marina Bay with lots of hotels and shopping centers nearby
reviews.title: Truly Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Service was genuine and friendly, including escort from check-in to room
reviews.title: excellent hotel, but gave off a business feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Decor was relatively modern (but note it hasn't been renovated for over 6 years)
reviews.title: Top notch hotel in great location

reviews.text: - Evening turndown
reviews.title: A Singapore hotel with top flight staff....at last

reviews.text: I visit Singapore regularly on business and, whenever possible, ask my clients to book me into The Conrad. Unfortunately they don't all do this as it isn't the cheapest hotel in towwn, but it always makes the return a little bit sweeter!
reviews.title: Professional, polished customer service

likes.liked: — comfortable, well appointed rooms and fantastic service
likes.disliked: — tv at awkward angle (isn't life tough!)

reviews.text: The service is just first rate. It's warm, genuine and welcoming without being cloying. The rooms are a good size, and if you're lucky enough to get an Executive Floor room, you'll get a good plasma or LCD TV as well. My only complaint is that the TV's are on a wall that means you can't lie flat out and watch through your feet! (Something everyone wants to do after a hard day of meetings!)
reviews.title: Lovely stay in Singapore

likes.disliked: — Pool menu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service food is average plus, but again the service is terrific and friendly. This is a hotel where people will actually talk to you! Not a great choice of hotel restaurants, but Golden Peony is quite good, and the hot and sour soup with lobster excellent. Heaps of restaurants nearby as well.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience!

likes.liked: — The bathroom and the Executive Lounge.
likes.disliked: — Our initial check-in, which we were able to straighen out on the spot. and the restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great and will be even better in a couple of years when the new MRT station opens up nearby, but even now, City Hall is only an easy 10 minute underground, airconditioned walk away. Suntec Exhibition Centre is just across the road, and the Paulaner Brewhouse is next door and offers great German beer.
reviews.title: A beautiful lady with a wart on the nose

likes.liked: — The hotel and the rooms are very well appointed.
likes.disliked: — Service staff need much better training and empowerment.

reviews.text: But, back to the hotel. Comfortable, well equipped rooms that are clean, light and airy, good facilities, good pool and spa, clean modern gym, convenient location....but I always come back to the service. It is willing, warm and welcoming. A hotel that is worth trying!
reviews.title: Good but Irregular

likes.disliked: — The non-smoking room had the smell of smoke

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was a piece de resistance. More choice than you could shake a stick at, brilliantly presented and prepared.
reviews.title: very happy with our choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for two nights on stopover to NZ. The hotel upgraded my wife and I to a suite on Exectuive floor as it was our annivesary. The hotel is brilliant, Room was plush and exquisite. Staff were great. Location is very good and within a short walk from all major tousisty bits. All in all the hotel could not be faulted. Although it is not the cheapest in Singapore I would rate it very high.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a couple of nights and it was fantastic, Comforatble sized rooms with great amentities. The higlight was definately the breakfast buffet though. It had everythng from normal breakfast items to chocolate, candy and ice-cream! The range was the best i have ever seen.
reviews.title: Amazing, Breakfast was such a highlight!

reviews.text: I stayed for a week in an executive room and have no complaints at all. The room was spotless and perfectly designed and soundproofed. The staff were very helpful and kind. The executive lounge was great and the pool deck was also really nice! Would definitely come back.
reviews.title: Perfect 5 star stay

reviews.text: Having stayed here in August and had a great time here, I returned here for a night as part of a short trip to SG. Checkin staff was very polite and helpful, and we paid a little extra to get upgraded to an executive suite--I must say the suite itself is very spacious, but the dining "room" space is not that well used and seems like a "wasted" space if you don't use the table a lot. The bedroom is nicely decorated, with the extremely comfortable and high bed, and nice bathroom with Acca Kappa amenities. An extra toilet near the suite entrance makes life a bit easier when you have a couple of people staying there. the sofas, chairs in the living room is not that comfortable and could help with a bit of upgrading, getting some new furnitures.
reviews.title: Faultless once again! Deserved to be the best in SG

reviews.text: One of the great things about Conrad is the wonderful executive lounge--located on the top (31st )floor of the hotel with magnificent view over to the CBD. A wide range of food selection during the afternoon tea period, and wide range of alcoholic and soft drinks as well. Had breakfast at 6.30 in the morning and the choice was again impressive--quite a lot of hot food choices alongside fruits/cold cuts and pastry selection. Executive Lounge is well worth the extra, not only because of the lounge access, but also that you light pressing for 5 items upon arrival, 50% off laundry and free local calls, all of which are quite handy. the only downside to the lounge is there is only 1 PC--should bring your own laptop/ipads to the lounge.
reviews.title: Always a Winner...

reviews.text: Every member, without exception, were ultra friendly, gracious and helpful. The overall atmosphere of the hotel is luxurious without being overpowering. It is centrally located with several shopping malls close by. the subway is so simple to use that i would recommend it highly, thereby avoiding rush-hour traffic jams. The breakfast is top class, with a great choice of different ethnic foods. bedrooms are luxurious and spacious, and the view of the marina is well worth it. While this is a large hotel, they are expert at providing the personal touch also
reviews.title: Luxurious, welcoming, clean and spacious - overall superb

reviews.text: I usually travel for business and Singapore is always better when we stay here. You get what you pay for. Top service. Great staff (I mean.. great) and an amazing service, specially for business meetings, conventions, expo, etc.
reviews.title: Top of the Top: Great hotel

reviews.text: I have stay here 3 times and 1 time was with my fiancee (now my wife). Fantastic service even back there.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in Singapore

reviews.text: They keep improving and their new chef give a nice charm to the restaurant.
reviews.title: Conrad Centennial Singapore: Destination for businessmen

reviews.text: I've probably stayed here about 5 times but last week was just superb. The hotel itself is not spectacular in any way but it's the staff that make the difference. Apart from the constant smiling and greeting, you feel that they are happy to support you in any way.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 5 days at this marvellous hotel after reading previous reviews on trip advisor. The hotel exceeded my expectations in many ways. Paid for an Executive Room with lounge access where Breakfast Lunch Afternoon Tea and Cocktails including Champagne were freely available accompanied by wonderful canapes - different every night. The food was of good quality, the service excellent, and atmosphere especially on a night overlooking the lights of Singapore truly memorable. The rooms were of excellent size with unobtrusive housekeeping twice daily. Beautiful spacious Marble bathrooms. The hotel is located in Marina Bay next to many shopping centres and a wide choice of restaurants.The concierge was particularly helpful and we navigated the metro (3 minutes walk from the hotel) to get to Orchard Road.
reviews.title: The perfect Singapore stay with 5 star service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a non-smoking room and at the check-in desk, the girl also verbally confirmed that. Another girl led us to our room. I am sure you know where this is leading to now.
reviews.title: Concierge Reluctant to Correct Their Mistake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As soon as we opened the door to the room, a pungent sharp cigarette smoke. It wasn't just a hint of smell, it was as strong as you can imagine, hit you right in the face. I kindly ask, is this really a non-smoking room? But she replied "well it's actually a smoking room". So we asked to change room. Seemed like a reasonable request, right?
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

reviews.text: The concierge called us back and said they rather just bring a ionizer/deodorizer to the room. At that point, I was a little confused. Isn't this Conrad, a 5-star hotel where customers come first? Isn't the mistake theirs of giving us a smoking room? What is the problem that they don't want to fix this?
reviews.title: Best in Singapore - great staff, plush rooms, superb location

reviews.text: My husband was on business in Singapore and I went along for the ride. I have stayed in hotels all over the world and have never experienced service like this. Check in was fantastic. Ten minutes tops. We were then escorted by receptionist to our room and explained air con, tv etc. Concierge desk was amazing. Nothing was too much trouble and all advice given was spot on. Room service was excellent and very fast. Ice blocks delivered to room twice a day without having to ask. Shopping in surrounding areas is great. Would definately stay there again.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

likes.disliked: — Everything was great

reviews.title: Terrific but for minor quirks

reviews.text: If you're looking for views, this is probably not the place, say compared to Swissotel, but overall, this shouldn't detract from the experience. So many things to see and do in Singapore that the length of time spent in the hotel room time may not be great !
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Great hotel located at a great location. The lobby gives you a clessy feeling and the check-in staff are always smiling. The room is clean and neat. The bathroom is very nice as well. They have the flat screen tv and DVD player in their rooms and the bed feels extremely comfortable as well. One of the best hotels that i have stayed.
reviews.title: Nice 5 star hotel

reviews.text: Can not fault this hotel. It all started with the great service through the hotel reservations department. Since we were travelling with my 2yo daughter, took the option of spending a little bit more and booked the Centennial Suite. As this is in the business floor area, were whisked to the Executive floor for check in. The room was excellent giving us a separate area for our 2yo (with a cot pre-arranged at no extra charge) while we watched TV on a huge plasma (another plasma is included in the bedroom). A small teddy bear was provided also for our daughter, as well as a little amenities pack which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great with children

likes.liked: — The suite and the big plasma
likes.disliked: — nothing

reviews.text: The hotel staff are very friendly and pleasant and the concierge most knowledgable. Staff treated our daughter like a celebrity almost to the point that we were like her entourage!! Surprised at other comments in respect to this hotel, and almost changed our booking because of it - so glad we didn't.
reviews.title: Average Business hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is clean, well maintained, and provides all of the touches expected of an international hotel. The pool was clean and a decent size. Breakfast was included and caters for all tastes with a good selection. We had dinner at Oscars one night and this also was good value for money in comparision to typical hotel meals/expenses.
reviews.title: Just a little bit ahead of the pack
A Really Nice Stay
reviews.text: We found the location well suited for our needs with many shopping areas near-by. Would recommend going to the Carrefour grocery store across from the hotel for snacks, drinks etc (very convenient with the little one requiring milk etc).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you don't mind the heat (or its not raining) would recommend walking to the City Hall MRT as it was less than 5mins (compared to at least 10 underground) and no escalators (at least 5 which is tricky with a stroller).
reviews.title: Very Comfortable and Pleasant Stay

likes.disliked: — Somewhat odd dated decor in the breakfast room by the pool

reviews.text: We were at the Conrad for the recent National Day holidays. We have stayed there 6 years ago and we are happy to see that the hotel property has maintained its relevance in terms of maintenance and service, if not exceeding in many aspects. The staff (from reservations, reception, poolside, security) were friendly, never rude, and were forthcoming in assistance. The place was spacious and even it was running full occupancy with the holidays, there was no noise to complain about. It is an excellent hotel if you are on business. If you have young children (like us), you probably need to be a bit careful with the high beds (though you can request for extra cot or fold-up bed for the young ones) and to note there is no kids pool. The executive lounge on the 31st level is a wonderful place to relax too. Perhaps they could improve on some of the food items (we had chicken rice and wanton noodle soup from room service); otherwise the National Day chocolate cake we had was very good. And of course, the rubber duckie and signature Conrad stuff bears were a great momentos for guests and kids to keep and to remind them to return again, and like my 5-year old who adds "soon please".
reviews.title: Great Place & Excellent Service

likes.liked: — First class hotel & service, Spacious property, Excellent views, Delightful takehome gifts
likes.disliked: — Food quality could be improved, A TV channel for kids would be nice.

reviews.text: After a quick flight in from Bangkok I took a taxi to the Conrad. I was greeted by many people and showed the front desk. Once they found out I was a Diamond member, I was taken to the executive lounge for check in.
reviews.title: 5 star!

Overall this Conrad scored big with me. I would defiantly stay here again when I return.

description: Conrad Centennial Singapore is a 31-storey; prestigious hotel conveniently located in Marina Bay, adjacent to Suntec Singapore - Convention & Exhibition Centre, with direct access to 1,000 shops and 300 restaurants, and close to Singapore's major attractions and cultural centres.Contemporary in design, the hotel offers 482 luxurious guest rooms and 25 suites, each with an array of home comforts and modern conveniences such as 46” HD LCD television with home-theatre system, wireless internet connectivity, an extensive line of toiletries as well as a choice of 16 different types of pillows from the Conrad Pillow menu. Guests staying on the Executive Floors or in Suites enjoy a host of additional entitlements and services, which include champagne breakfast, all-day house pour beverages, afternoon teas and evening cocktails with canapés in the Executive Lounge on 31st floor. Conrad Centennial Singapore also offers a variety of award-winning dining options and a 24-hour in-room dining service.Golden Peony, the renowned Chinese restaurant, serves exquisite dim sum and contemporary Cantonese à la carte dishes prepared by top Hong Kong master chefs, while Oscar’s offers 24-hour delicious Asian and international cuisine, including a selection of over 40 wines- by- the- glass (100ml and 200ml). Conrad Centennial Singapore also features an elegant Lobby Lounge which is perfect for before or after dinner drinks, afternoon teas and executive lunches.Conrad Centennial Singapore is an outstanding choice for meetings, incentives, conventions and exhibitions (MICE) as well as social events. Facilities include a magnificent ballroom catering up to 500 guests, six salon rooms, four conference rooms and three boardrooms, complemented by modern technological facilities and creative food concepts.
